p: However, when n-3 fatty acids are lacking, DHA supply to the brain becomes insufficient. ( Caracciolo et al., 2014). Fatty fish including tuna, mackerel and sardine is the major dietary sources of eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA, 20:5n-3) and DHA, as longer-chain n-3 PUAs. Enriched diet of n-3 fatty acid is known to be helpful to maintain cognitive process in human ( McCann and Ames, 2005) and to upregulate expressions of many genes for maintaining synaptic function and plasticity in rodents ( Wu et al., 2007). As dietary component, polyphenols are derived metabolites of plants and include flavonoids, lignans, coumarins, and tannins and appear to act on the brain in several ways ( Ghosh and Scheepens, 2009; Patel et al., 2008). It has been known that frequent intake of fruits and vegetables was related with a reduced risk of all types of nervous related degeneration diseases ( Barberger-Gateau et al., 2007).
